sentences.sContent: the most likely cause of the problem
sentences.sCn: 造成这个问题最有可能的原因

sentences.sContent: It is more than likely (= almost certain ) the votes will have to be counted again.
sentences.sCn: 选票很有可能要重新点算。

sentences.sContent: It could have been an accident, but that was hardly likely (= not very likely ).
sentences.sCn: 这有可能是意外事故，但可能性不大。

sentences.sContent: I’d very likely have done the same thing in your situation.
sentences.sCn: 我要是处在你这种情况，也很有可能会那样做的。

sentences.sContent: ...they are still likely to suffer from “false memories”...
...Men are more likely to face that dispute from the perspective of what benefits them most...
...The scientists concluded that lions are also likely to live in a neighboring national park across the border in Sudan...
...Did you know women are more likely than men to feel exhausted...
...and new research reveals that men are more likely to receive excellent letters of recommendation...
...and less likely to be bored or lonely...
...They were less likely to report symptoms of depression than those in the other facilities...
...Do you have the right combination of subjects and are your expected grades likely to meet entry requirements...
...Other skin cancers are increasingly likely with long-term exposure...
...record-cold days will likely turn out to have outnumbered record-warm ones...

synos.tran: 很可能的；合适的；有希望的

phrases.pCn: 最不可能的是；较少可能

words.tran: 令人喜爱的，可爱的（等于likable）

trans.tranOther: something that is likely will probably happen or is probably true
